result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:50 PM Defendant Adam V. Hersha in Court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court for Adam V. Hersha.  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  NG pleas entered.  Adjourned at 3:50 PM

3:48 PM Defendant Adam V. Hersha in Court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court for Adam V. Hersha.  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises Defendant of right to Preliminary Hearing.  Court finds defendant freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.  Court binds Defendant over for further proceedings.

3:46 PM Defendant Adam V. Hersha in Court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in Court for Adam V. Hersha.  District Attorney Halle E. Hatch in Court for the State of Wisconsin.  State does not object to quashing warrant but notes they will request cash if another appearance is missed.  Court quashes warrant and reinstates bond.

11:30 AM Defendant Adam V. Hersha not in court.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court for Adam V. Hersha. Defendant had requested remote appearance, court denied request.  DA Hatch requests warrant.  Court grants request for warrant and will sign when presented.  Adjourned at 11:32 a.m.
from Ct Comm Gavic to Remote Appearance Request "The Defendant's request to appear remotely for the scheduled prelim is denied. JRG"

records.addlTxt: Phil Helgeson

11:35 AM Defendant Adam V. Hersha in court.  Attorney Halle E. Hatch in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Helgeson has been appointed but is unable to be at the preliminary hearing today. Defendant wishes to waive time limits and have preliminary hearing rescheduled.  Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements for preliminary hearing.  Officer may be released.  Hatch - alleged victim wishes to be included in scheduling. Court calls alleged victim.  Off record for scheduling.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.  
Adjourned at 11:50 a.m.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH J.D.

3:03 PM Defendant Adam V. Hersha appears incustody  from Jail via video, Atty Kaitlyn Dipplito appears via zoom, DA Halle E. Hatch for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Court questions non-appearance, Defendant responds. State: quashed and is requesting a $1,000.00 cash bond w/same conditions, Atty Dipplito argues. Court will quash the warrant and orders a cash bond $500.00 w/same conditions. DE requests PH. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:11 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return of property hearing on September 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:30 AM Defendant Adam V. Hersha does not appear in Court,  DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes Officer is present. Court notes a telephone message from DE stating he could not appear today. DA Hatch is requesting a warrant and costs for the Officer's time of $108.33. Court will authorize the warrant adj. States and will authorize the costs of $108.33 for the Officer's time. Court adjourned at 11:32 am.
from DE at 8:43 am stating he is working on his car and cannot fax a request to reset because he does not have a access. eif
Preliminary hearing on June 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.

per DE in court. eif
NO CONTACT WHATSOEVER WITH J.D.
Def from PCJ

3:06 PM Defendant Adam V. Hersha appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl Nelson, DA Halle E. Hatch appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. DA Hatch is requesting a $1,000.00 CB w/conditions of NC w/J.D., objection, DA Hatch argues. Victim makes a statement. Court orders a $10,000.00 SIBS w/conditions. Prelim demanded. DE does not qualify for PD.  Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:16 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 11:30 am.
